contentfulLibrary.title: The Benefit of Efficient On-Demand Network

description.description:
Meituan is one of the very few super apps that Chinese consumers cannot live without in their daily lives.

Digital Economy
Digital Transformation
ETF
5G ETF 
WUGI

content.value: Nicknamed by investors as the "Amazon for local services" in China,

in both "food delivery" and "in-store/hotel services." Meituan's "food delivery business" has consistently taken market shares from its rivals through strong execution. Its larger scale empowered it with improving unit economics: its food delivery unit's operating margin reached 8.8% in the most recent quarter, substantially higher than its rivals'. Meanwhile, its "in-store/hotel" service is also a high margin business, thanks to the advertising plus commission model.
While COVID-19 negatively affected Meituan in Q1'20, the company has emerged from the pandemic much stronger.
The health crisis has accelerated a structural shift in customer behavior, pushing them to order food and services online more frequently

. To embrace this shift, many high-end restaurants also joined Meituan's food delivery network after the pandemic. Meituan, on average, completed a massive amount of 24.5 million daily food delivery transactions during the second quarter.
To support deliveries at such a scale, Meituan has spent a decade building an efficient on-demand delivery network that has become a critical part of China's social infrastructure.

The
network seamlessly connects 1 million daily active riders, 6.3 million active merchants, and 457 million customers

. During the lock-down, Meituan helped absorbed many unemployed workers from the hardest-hit industries. In a recent report, Meituan disclosed that there were 2.95 million income-earning riders on its platform during the first half of 2020. There are only around 3 million couriers (express delivery) throughout China to put
things into perspective.

description.en-US: Meituan: Efficient On-Demand Network to Fuel the Next Era of Growth

content.value: Backed by a strong army of riders, an efficient on-demand network, and a sky-high reputation among consumers,
Meituan is aggressively expanding into other verticals: a) grocery deliveries, b) consumer finance, and c) eCommerce

Grocery deliveries are growing several times faster than the overall eCommerce globally. Meituan has already established itself as a front-runner by delivering goods to consumers in less than 30 minutes through both marketplace and self-operating model.

Alibaba and Tencent have been dominating consumer finance in China. Meituan recently joined the force by rolling out "monthly payment," a consumer loan service similar to Ant's Huabei, a highly lucrative business. By adding credit services, we reckon that Meituan could simplify the overall user experience on its platform, improve user conversion, and eventually turn it into a profitable business.

In terms of eCommerce, Meituan launched "Youxuan," a service focusing on community group buying. Our channel check also indicates that Meituan is close to launching an eCommerce platform featuring its private-label brands in the FMCG (fast-moving consumer goods) category, with a particular focus on aesthetic and beauty products.
Meituan is one of the very few super apps that Chinese consumers cannot live without in their daily lives

. Millions of offline merchants also rely on Meituan's platform for their day-to-day operations. In the next few years, we expect Meituan to keep growing its delivery services by 30%+ CAGR. In-store/hotel businesses will eventually rebound. The company undertakes several new expansions with vast potential that the market currently underestimates.
